intro: Erigeron basaseachensis, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments.
